definitions.definition: Any of the wild species of apple tree, genus Malus, which generally yield small, bitter fruit (in comparison to domestic apples, Malus domestica).
The fruit of this tree.
An unpleasant person; a person who is crabby.
A team sport where two teams of seven players each (six players and a goalkeeper) pass and bounce a ball trying to throw it in the goal of the opposing team.
The medium-sized inflated ball used in this sport.
The offence of a player other than the goalkeeper touching the ball with the hand or arm on the field during play.
A sport in which players alternately strike the ball against a wall with their hand. Irish and American variants have slightly different rules.
The small rubber ball used in this sport.
(Australian Rules Football) An act of passing a football by holding it with one hand and hitting it with the other.
A schoolyard game in which a tennis ball is struck with the hand, played on a improvised court on the asphalt or pavement.
To manually load or unload a container, trailer, or to otherwise manually move bulk goods (often on pallets) from one type of transport receptacle to another.
To illegally touch the ball with the hand or arm.
definitions.example: If the defender handballs in the penalty area, a penalty is awarded.

definitions.definition: To (legally) pass a football by holding it with one hand and hitting it with the other.
(sexuality) To insert a hand into someone's anus.
A (convex) quadrilateral with two (non-adjacent) parallel sides.
A convex quadrilateral with no sides parallel and no equal sides.
The trapezoid bone of the wrist.
A mother.
A person related through the mother, or her side of the family; a maternal relative.
Of or pertaining to a mother; having the characteristics of a mother; motherly.
definitions.example: His weakness seemed to bring out her maternal instincts.

definitions.definition: Related through the mother, or her side of the family.
definitions.example: Toby is my maternal uncle.

definitions.definition: Derived from the mother as opposed to the foetus during pregnancy.
A household appliance used for keeping food fresh by refrigeration (short form fridge).
One who has a chilling influence.
A systematic cleaning of a residence at the end of winter
(by extension) A systematic cleaning, reorganization, or weeding out of a system
A hard, usually nut-flavored biscuit, derived from the Tuscan cantuccio.
A boy who serves as a page.
A shoulder-length hairstyle with the ends of the hair curled under.
Law developed by judges through court decisions and opinions, as distinct from statute and other legislation.
A mature or elderly woman.
A wife or a widow, especially, one who has borne children.
A woman of staid or motherly manners.
A housekeeper, especially, a woman who manages the domestic economy of a public institution.
A senior female nurse in an establishment, especially a hospital or school.
definitions.example: the matron of a school or hospital

definitions.definition: A female prison officer.
(usually in the plural) A pellet of dry cat food.
Likely to crunch, especially with reference to food when it is eaten.
Having sensibilities of a counter-culture nature lover or hippie; derived from the concept of crunchy granola.
definitions.example: San Francisco is a very crunchy town.

definitions.definition: To assess again; to revise an earlier assessment; to reevaluate

Any species of fish of the family Tetraodontidae that have the ability to inflate themselves to a globe several times their normal size by swallowing water or air when threatened; puffer, blowfish, swellfish, balloonfish, globefish.
A delicacy popular in Japan served raw as sushi that may, if improperly prepared, contain deadly levels of neurotoxins; (Japanese) fugu.
Any of various projecting beams or spars that provide support for a sailing ship's mast.
A long thin timber, pontoon, or other float attached parallel to a canoe or boat by projecting struts as a means of preventing tipping or capsizing.
An outrigger canoe or boat.
An iron bracket or brace for an oarlock projecting from the side of a rowing boat.
An extension mechanism, often retractable when not in use, on a boat, vehicle, or structure which helps to stabilize it to keep it from tipping over.

A type of ski pole, with skis attached at the bottom, instead of the spike/pick found on a normal pole. It is used in downhill skiing variants of para-skiing, especially those that use a sit-ski, such as the monoski.
The act of one who lumbers; heavy, clumsy movement.
The business of felling trees for lumber.
Clumsy or awkward.
Heavy, slow and laborious; ponderous.
To build more or better than.
A building, such as a barn, shed, or garage, that is separate from, but associated with some main building
To advance or increase with stealth, unnoticed (literally or figuratively).
definitions.example: The lioness has to creep up behind her prey so as not to be noticed.

definitions.definition: A transaction in which a business firm, or a controlling share of a firm, is purchased using money which was borrowed by pledging all or some of the firm's assets as collateral.
One who roasts food.
A kitchen utensil used for roasting.
A chicken, pig, etc. suitable for roasting.
A furnace used in making ball soda.
One who roasts or banters, especially as a comedy routine.
A hot Jupiter.
An objectionable person; somebody making a fool of themselves.
Of, pertaining to, or exhibiting opposition
Any animal belonging to the Suidae family of mammals, especially the pig, the warthog, and the boar.
(specifically) An adult swine (contrasted with a pig, a young swine).
A greedy person; one who refuses to share.
A large motorcycle, particularly a Harley-Davidson.
A young sheep that has not been shorn.
A rough, flat scrubbing broom for scrubbing a ship's bottom under water.
A device for mixing and stirring the pulp from which paper is made.
A shilling coin; its value, 12 old pence.
A tanner, a sixpence coin; its value.
A half-crown coin; its value, 30 old pence.
The effect of the middle of the hull of a ship rising while the ends droop
To greedily take more than one's share, to take precedence at the expense of another or others.
definitions.example: Hey! Quit hogging all the blankets.

definitions.definition: To clip the mane of a horse, making it short and bristly.
To scrub with a hog, or scrubbing broom.
To cause the keel of a ship to arch upwards (the opposite of sag).
To process (bark, etc.) into hog fuel.
A quahog (clam)
A drink dating back to the 16th century consisting primarily of milk curdled with an alcoholic beverage or some acid such as lemon juice, which is usually then sweetened and spiced.
Also everlasting syllabub or solid syllabub: a dessert pudding derived from the drink.
Something lacking substance; something frothy, insubstantial, or lightweight.
The action of mocking; ridicule, derision.
Something so lacking in necessary qualities as to inspire ridicule; a laughing-stock.
Something insultingly imitative; an offensively futile action, gesture etc.
Mimicry, imitation, now usually in a derogatory sense; a travesty, a ridiculous simulacrum.
definitions.example: The defendant wasn't allowed to speak at his own trial - it was a mockery of justice.

definitions.definition: The state of being kind.
An instance of kind or charitable behaviour.
definitions.example: How can I thank you for your many kindnesses?

definitions.definition: The branch of mathematics that deals with the relationships between the sides and the angles of triangles and the calculations based on them, particularly the trigonometric functions.
An advocate of nationalism.
definitions.example: You are either a globalist or a nationalist; one cannot be both.

definitions.definition: Of or relating to nationalism.
To provide real-time updates or commentary on an event in progress through Twitter posts.
A branch of an olive tree offered as an emblem of peace.
Any symbol of peace, or a peace offering to an adversary to show goodwill and in the hope of securing peace.
To extend an olive branch; to make a peace offering; to attempt to restore peaceful relations.
A film made for television.
That which is believed; accepted doctrine, especially religious doctrine; a particular set of beliefs; any summary of principles or opinions professed or adhered to.
(specifically) A reading or statement of belief that summarizes the faith it represents; a confession of faith for public use, especially one which is brief and comprehensive.
definitions.example: A creed is a manifesto of religious or spiritual beliefs

definitions.definition: The fact of believing; belief, faith.
(only survives in "creeded") To believe; to credit.
To provide with a creed.
A life jacket.
The egg of a louse.
A young louse.
A head louse regardless of its age.
A fool, a nitwit.
A nitpicker.
A minor shortcoming.
A candela per square meter.
definitions.example: This brightness of this LCD screen is between 900 and 1000 nits.

definitions.definition: A spirit in Burmese mythology, whose cult is followed alongside Buddhism.
A logarithmic unit of information or entropy, based on natural logarithms.
A musical composition for one or a few instruments, one of which is frequently a piano, in three or four movements that vary in key and tempo.
Having a quality that divides or separates
definitions.example: Rather than fostering unity, he becomes divisive.

definitions.definition: Careful with money so as not to spend too much; prudent; thrifty.
definitions.example: He was an economical person by nature.

definitions.definition: Saving money or resources.
definitions.example: The new, eco-friendly bicycle was an economical purchase.

definitions.definition: Relating to economy in any other sense.
On the part of a stage that is visible to the audience.
Taking place on the part of a stage that is visible to the audience.
A tempo mark directing that a passage is to be played in a moderately slow tempo; faster than adagio but slower than moderato.
A passage having this mark.
Describing a passage having this mark.
Played at a moderately slow tempo.
The act of emigrating; movement of a person or persons out of a country or national region, for the purpose of permanent relocation of residence.
A body of emigrants; emigrants collectively
definitions.example: the Irish emigration

definitions.definition: The deliberate non-suicidal injuring of one's own body.
To harm oneself deliberately.
A receptacle in a church for holy water, especially one used in baptism.
A receptacle for oil in a lamp.
Spring, source, fountain.

A set of glyphs of unified design, belonging to one typeface (e.g., Helvetica), style (e.g., italic), and weight (e.g., bold). Usually representing the letters of an alphabet and its supplementary characters.
A computer file containing the code used to draw and compose the glyphs of one or more typographic fonts on a computer display or printer.
To overlay (text) on the picture.
A source, wellspring, fount.
Brave, valiant.
Honorable.
Grand, noble.
Showy; splendid; magnificent; gay; well-dressed.
A fashionable young man who is polite and attentive to women.
One who woos, a lover, a suitor, a seducer.
Topgallant
To attend or wait on (a lady).
definitions.example: to gallant ladies to the play

definitions.definition: To handle with grace or in a modish manner.
definitions.example: to gallant a fan

definitions.definition: Polite and attentive to ladies; courteous to women; chivalrous.
A disinfecting liquid used as an alternative to washing the hands with soap and water.
To prepare food by cutting it into strips.
To kiss (another person) while inserting one’s tongue into the other person's mouth.
To kiss in this manner.
To French trim; to stylishly expose bone by removing the fat and meat covering it (as done to a rack of lamb or bone-in rib-eye steak).
A small spoon used to stir the contents of a cup or glass.
A unit of measure, equivalent to one-third of a tablespoon or roughly five milliliters.
Lazy, unmotivated
Untrustworthy as a result of being incompetent at the job
Destitute of shifts or expedients; lacking proper means
A fire, especially a fast-burning fire producing a lot of flames and light.
Intense, direct light accompanied with heat.
definitions.example: to seek shelter from the blaze of the sun

definitions.definition: The white or lighter-coloured markings on a horse's face.
definitions.example: The palomino had a white blaze on its face.

definitions.definition: A high-visibility orange colour, typically used in warning signs and hunters' clothing.
A bursting out, or active display of any quality; an outburst.
A spot made on trees by chipping off a piece of the bark, usually as a surveyor's mark.
A hand consisting of five face cards.
To be on fire, especially producing bright flames.
definitions.example: The campfire blazed merrily.

definitions.definition: To send forth or reflect a bright light; shine like a flame.
To be conspicuous; shine brightly a brilliancy (of talents, deeds, etc.).
To set in a blaze; burn.
To cause to shine forth; exhibit vividly; be resplendent with.
(only in the past participle) To mark with a white spot on the face (as a horse).
To set a mark on (as a tree, usually by cutting off a piece of its bark).
To indicate or mark out (a trail, especially through vegetation) by a series of blazes.
definitions.example: The guide blazed his way through the undergrowth.

definitions.definition: To set a precedent for the taking-on of a challenge; lead by example.
definitions.example: Darwin blazed a path for the rest of us.

definitions.definition: To be furiously angry; to speak or write in a rage.
To smoke marijuana.
Publication; the act of spreading widely by report
To blow, as from a trumpet
To publish; announce publicly
To disclose; bewray; defame
To blazon

An electromechanical communications device consisting of a typewriter keyboard and printer together with a punched paper tape reader/writer and connection to a modem so that information may be sent and received over a telephone system.
The first night, evening, or day, of a spectacle or show
The first event in a new venue
A road shoulder made of gravel rather than asphalt or concrete.
The course of stages through which an organism passes from fertilized zygote until maturity, reproduction, and death.
(by extension) The useful life of a product or system; the developmental history of an individual or group in society.
A person with no involvement or no interest in politics.
An unbiased candidate or voter, free of a party platform.
A neutral or uncommitted person.
Having no interest or involvement in politics.
definitions.example: The Queen is an apolitical figure.

definitions.definition: Having no political relevance or function.
definitions.example: The PM's visit to the school was entirely apolitical.

definitions.definition: Politically neutral, unbiased, non-aligned, free from party politics
A deliberately offensive or provocative talk show host.
An agent acting as a mediator between sides that may disagree.
An arranger of a contract or other agreement who is separate from the parties to the agreement
One or several stages of an event which occurs after the start and before the end.
A person or organisation in an intermediate position in a supply chain of goods or services
definitions.example: The intermediary between the manufacturer and retailer is the wholesaler

definitions.definition: Intermediate.
The personnel department of an organization, dealing with the recruitment, administration, management and training of employees; abbreviated as HR.
The personnel employed in an organization.
A covering for the head, worn on solemn occasions by church dignitaries, which has been made in many forms, mostly recently a tall cap with two points or peaks.
The surface forming the bevelled end or edge of a piece where a miter joint is made; also, a joint formed or a junction effected by two beveled ends or edges; a miter joint.
A 13th-century coin minted in Europe which circulated in Ireland as a debased counterfeit sterling penny, outlawed under Edward I.
A cap or cowl for a chimney or ventilation pipe.
A gusset in sewing, etc.
A square with one triangular quarter missing from the outside.
To adorn with a mitre.
To unite at an angle of 45°.
The process of removing constraints, especially government-imposed economic regulation.
definitions.example: Some say the airline industry has not been profitable since Ronald Reagan began deregulation.

definitions.definition: Having or showing pluck, courage or spirit in trying circumstances.
The unlawful taking of personal property as an attempt to deprive the legal owner of it permanently.
A larcenous act attributable to an individual.
definitions.example: That young man already has four assaults, a DUI, and a larceny on his record.

definitions.definition: The superior or head of an abbey or monastery.
definitions.example: The newly appointed abbot decided to take a tour of the abbey with the cardinal's emissary.

definitions.definition: The pastor and/or administrator of an order, including minor and major orders starting with the minor order of porter.
A layman who received the abbey's revenues, after the closing of the monasteries.
(British slang) A brothel-owner's husband or lover.
(British slang) A ponce; a man employed by a prostitute to find clients, and who may also act as a bodyguard or equivalent to a bouncer.
Any substance that is dissolved in a liquid solvent to create a solution
To dissolve.
To absolve.
definitions.example: to solute sin

definitions.definition: Loose; free; liberal
definitions.example: a solute interpretation

definitions.definition: Relaxed, hence, merry; cheerful
Able to be dissolved; soluble
definitions.example: a solute salt

definitions.definition: Not adhering; loose; opposed to adnate
definitions.example: a solute stipule

definitions.definition: A town or harbour with facilities for seagoing ships to dock and take on or discharge cargo.
The steering apparatus of a ship, especially the tiller or wheel.
(maritime) The member of the crew in charge of steering the boat.
A position of leadership or control.
definitions.example: the helm of the Commonwealth

definitions.definition: One at the place of direction or control; a guide; a director.
A helve.
To be a helmsman or a member of the helm; to be in charge of steering the boat.
(by extension) To lead (a project, etc.).
A helmet.
A helmet.
A heavy cloud lying on the brow of a mountain.
The stems of various cultivated plants, left after harvesting the crop to be used as animal litter or for thatching.
An individual plant stem.
Part of a harness; a hame.
A pile of garden or other organic waste which is left to decompose. See also compost.
Having been dried by the sun.
A climbing vine, Apios americana, of eastern North America, having fragrant brownish flowers and small edible tubers.
Any similar plant having underground tubers.
The nutlike tuber of such a plant, especially peanuts.
A plant which bears its nutlike seeds underground, such as a peanut or Bambara groundnut.
Egotistically obsessed with oneself.
Concerned with the self, as opposed to the greater good of one's group, community, tribe, etc.; individualistic.
A room in a business set aside for the display of the company's products.
A room or apartment where a show is exhibited.
To inspect merchandise in a physical store, then purchase the identical product from an online merchant; to use a physical store as a showroom for an online merchant.
definitions.example: This new phone looks good, but I want to go to the mall and showroom it before buying.

definitions.definition: (of a pet) Trained not to excrete indoors.
(by extension) Exhibiting behavior and habits that are consistent with good housekeeping.
A striking and vivid representation; a picture.
A vivid graphic scene of a group of people arranged as in a painting or bas relief sculpture.
Hence, an arrangement of actors in static positions on stage, having the effect of pointing up a particular moment in the drama, conventionally revealed by opening tableau curtains (known as "tabs").
A table (two-dimensional presentation of data).
Mostly in solitaire card games, but also in other card and board games, the main area, where random cards can be arranged.
A semantic tableau.
A dish consisting of layers of minced lamb or beef, sliced aubergine (eggplant) or potatoes, tomatoes and béchamel sauce, baked in the oven.
Short for COVID-19, the disease caused by Severe acute respiratory syndrome-related coronavirus.
A cubit.
A chi.
A springboard used for diving into water.
A diving platform.
Somewhat fat, pudgy, overweight.
Having a dignified bearing; handsome, imposing.
Reckless boldness; foolish bravery.
An act or case of reckless boldness.
Effrontery; impudence.
A slender projection of a nerve cell which conducts nerve impulses from a synapse to the body of the cell; a dendron.
Slender cell process emanating from the cell bodies of dendritic cells and follicular dendritic cells of the immune system.
Tree-like structure of crystals growing as material crystallizes
A hermit who lived in a tree
